newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia sells 35-day T-bills, sets new auction.
newsitem.headline: Croatia sells 35-day T-bills, sets new auction.

text.p: Croatia's Finance Ministry said on Tuesday it raised 96 million kuna through a 35-day treasury bills priced at 98.956 kuna.
The price and the rate, set at 11 percent, remained flat since the last auction on October 1.
The bills are payable on October 24 and they mature on November 28.
Bids totaled 153.3 million at 2.87 to 14 percent rates. The wighted average was 10.44 percent.
The ministry will next auction 35-day bills on November 5. The auctions are not open to foreign investors. -- Davor Huic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
